description:
Starting from the basics: introduction to Elixir and its ecosystem, introductory exercises. 

Feel free to come work at DevSpace any time earlier in the afternoon if you want to beat the traffic.

The lecture will start at 7pm.

Please bring a laptop with Elixir installed. You can find installation instructions here: http://elixir-lang.org/getting_started/1.html .
name: Kick-Off Meeting

description:
Elixir has a powerful and expressive concurrent programming model built right into the language and taking full advantage of the Erlang VM.

Let's discover together how to "think in processes" and distribute work transparently across CPUs and network nodes.

Feel free to come working at DevSpace anytime in the afternoon. Talk starts at 7pm.
name: Hands-on Introduction to the Elixir Concurrency Model

description:
Time to start writing an application in Elixir.

A number of topics will be covered on the way: an intro to OTP, project management with mix, custom mix tasks, web dev with Plug, interop with Erlang libraries, a bit on Elixir protocols, and much more.

To brew the magic potion you'll need the following ingredients:

* a laptop with Elixir 1.0

* completed exercises of previous meetups (https://github.com/belgian-elixir-study-group/meetup-materials)

* good mood

Feel free to come work at DevSpace anytime in the afternoon if your want to avoid driving in peak hours. 

We'll start at  7pm.
name: Learn to brew an Elixir potion: crush, heat, stir, shake...

description:
Using ExUnit as an example of top-of-the-line Elixir code, we will dive deep into the application's internals to study its architecture and clever implementation.

In the process, we will discover new idioms, interesting patterns, some awesome tricks and we will finally make our first steps into the world of metaprogramming.

Feel free to come work at DevSpace anytime in the afternoon if you want to avoid driving in peak hours.

The talk starts at 7pm.
name: Exploring ExUnit

description:
Using ExUnit as an example of top-of-the-line Elixir code, we will dive deep into the application's internals to study its architecture and clever implementation.

In the first part of this talk, we have focused on the test runner, in this second and final installment, we will dive head first into one of Elixir most awesome feature: metaprogramming.

Feel free to come work at DevSpace anytime in the afternoon if you want to avoid driving in peak hours.

The talk starts at 7pm.
name: Exploring ExUnit, Part 2 • Metaprogramming
